title: Growth Marketing & Demand Generation Specialist (B2B Focus)
job_overview:
Job Title: Growth Marketing & Demand Generation Specialist (B2B Focus)

Location: Remote (Must be available during U.S. business hours)

About the Role:

We’re looking for a seasoned B2B Growth Marketer with a strong track record of driving net new sales meetings through creative and data-driven marketing. This is not a role for someone who needs hand-holding. You’ll be expected to take high-level direction and rapidly translate it into well-executed, measurable campaigns across the digital ecosystem.

If you thrive in ambiguity, have mastery over AI tools for data/list creation and outreach, and can move from strategy to execution with confidence — this is your role.

?

Key Responsibilities:
 • Drive pipeline growth through full-funnel demand generation tactics (paid, organic, outbound, event-based, and referral programs).
 • Build and execute outbound list strategies using AI tools (e.g., Clay, ChatGPT, Apollo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator).
 • Design, launch, and optimize cold email and social outreach campaigns to book qualified meetings.
 • Create and iterate landing pages, lead magnets, and email sequences that convert.
 • Collaborate with leadership and sales to understand ICPs and messaging that resonates with buyers.
 • Monitor, report, and optimize KPIs across the funnel — from lead to booked meeting.
 • Own growth campaigns end-to-end with minimal direction and high output.
 • Manage marketing ops tools (HubSpot or similar) and workflows to ensure clean handoffs to sales.
 • Contribute to broader digital strategy and execution across paid media, SEO, and social if needed.
 • Support and collaborate on cross-functional initiatives (events, webinars, partnerships).

?

Requirements:
 • 5+ years of experience in B2B growth marketing and/or demand generation.
 • Strong command of English with persuasive writing chops (especially for outbound copy).
 • Demonstrated ability to generate pipeline through outbound channels and AI-powered workflows.
 • Mastery of modern marketing and automation tools (HubSpot, Clearbit, LinkedIn, N8N, etc.).
 • Deep understanding of how to segment, enrich, and nurture leads using data and behavioral triggers.
 • Strong grasp of positioning, testing, and rapid iteration.
 • Highly self-directed and able to execute without waiting for permission.
 • Availability during standard U.S. business hours (Eastern or Central preferred).

?

Bonus Points:
 • Experience working in or with SaaS or Fintech (especially wealthtech).
 • Familiarity with the U.S. financial advisory space and/or private investing.
 • Experience running and optimizing B2B podcast or media-based demand campaigns.
 • Working knowledge of AI-enabled growth strategies (e.g., automating outbound, content repurposing, etc.).
 • Comfortable building and managing lightweight ad campaigns (LinkedIn, Meta, Google).

?

What Success Looks Like:
 • You consistently generate qualified sales meetings every week.
 • You reduce CAC and shorten the sales cycle through better targeting and messaging.
 • You build predictable, repeatable marketing motions that can scale.
 • You proactively identify new growth opportunities and act on them.

?

What You’ll Get:
 • The freedom to build your playbook — we care about results, not micromanagement.
 • A chance to work alongside founders and leadership to directly impact growth.
 • Exposure to a modern tech stack and opportunity to test your ideas rapidly.
 • Room to grow your role as the company scales.

?

To Apply:

Send us 2–3 short bullet points about:
 1. The most successful growth play you’ve personally run.
 2. Your favorite AI tool and how you use it.
 3. A link to a campaign (or message) you wrote that worked.

?

? Additional elements you might want to include:
 • Clarify ownership of pipeline targets (e.g., are they solely responsible or part of a shared goal with sales?).
 • Clarify budget authority — can they run ads, hire freelancers, use tools freely?
 • Clarify structure — Will they report to a CMO, CEO, or work independently?
 • Mention tools you’re already using — HubSpot Pro, N8N, Snowflake, etc., to attract relevant experience.
